newsitem.title: USA: ArQule, Wyeth-Ayerst in drug collaboration.
newsitem.headline: ArQule, Wyeth-Ayerst in drug collaboration.

text.p: ArQule Inc on Thursday said it has entered into a collaboration with Wyeth-Ayerst Pharmaceuticals to discover drug candidates for a minimum of 15 of Wyeth-Ayerst's selected pharmaceutical targets.
Wyeth-Ayerst, a division of American Home Products Corp will pay ArQule about $28 million, which includes a $2 million equity investment in ArQule to be paid in 1998.
A Wyeth-Ayerst spokesman said the collaboration will help the companies identify molecular compounds which have the potential to treat specific unmet medical needs.

"Molecular compounds each have a certain behavior, so the diseases that you can treat are dictated by this activity," he said. "This (joint) technology will enable us to develop drugs to target specfic theraputic needs."
Wyeth-Ayerst will make further payments to ArQule throughout the five-year collaboration as development milestones are reached.
In addition, ArQule said it will be entitled to royalties from sales of any products emanating from this collaboration.

Anticipated cumulative payments to ArQule from this collaboration, including fees and milestones, but excluding royalties, will exceed $100 million as compounds enter clinical trials and if five of those compounds reach the product approval stage.
